thread.title: Preps roundup: McIlroy, Land lead ’Cat runners
thread.title_full: Preps roundup: McIlroy, Land lead ’Cat runners

title: Preps roundup: McIlroy, Land lead ’Cat runners
text: Preps roundup: McIlroy, Land lead Cat runners Preps roundup: McIlroy, Land lead Cat runners By The Union Democrat Sports Department October 13, 2015 01:00 am The Sonora cross country team competed Saturday at the Clovis Invitational at Woodward Park in Fresno. In the varsity boys race, Jackson McIlroy was the first ‘Cat to finish and he was 16th overall out of 237 runners with a time of 16:19.5. McIlroy had an outstanding average mile time of 5:15.1 and set a personal record for the course. Keiman Kostlivy finished 216th overall with a time of 19:38.5 and Gonzalo Pazos finished in 20:09.2 and 225th overall. In the girls division, Cassie Land led the ‘Cats with an 18:32.5 finishing time, which put here 26th. Her time was a course personal record. Victoria French finished in 21:28.5 and in 159th overall. Kaarina Thompson finished in 175th with a 22.29.6, a personal record for the course. Kennedy Bruce finished with a 23:31.4; Natalie Hawks in 24:39.8; and Hannah Dowler in 27:13.8. Sonora will participate on Saturday in the Bronco Invitational. “This is a preview of the section meet course and there are 14 division IV teams entered including our former arch nemesis Sierra of Manteca,” said head coach Glenn Bass. “I realize this is homecoming week and there will be a lot of activities and distractions, but this is an important meet and we must be focused.” JV—Travis Moore finished first for Sonora with a time of 26:31.1. Bret Harte volleyers earn 3-set win Thursday over Amador The Bret Harte Bullfrogs volleyball team got back into the win column Thursday night with a 3-0 sweep of Amador (25-12, 25-13, 25-10). Sophomore Katie Juarez led Bret Harte with eight kills. She also had a team-high five aces and 10 digs. Carley Herndon, Addison Stafford and Morgan Puccinelli all had five kills. Herndon had three aces and nine digs. Stafford had a team-high 23 assists. Christine Lora finished with 17 digs and Adri Davies had four blocks. Bret Harte (16-6, 4-2 MLL) will host Calaveras (9-3, 5-1 MLL) today at 6 p.m. The ‘Frogs are looking to avenge a late September 3-0 road sweep against the ‘Skins. Timberwolves volleyball sweeps Able Charter The Tioga Timberwolves beat Humphreys Able Charter Friday in three sets 25-14, 25-18 and 25-17. Tioga was led by Jenn Harvey with 12 service aces and three kills. Sophomore Ada Pollock matched Harvey with a team-high three kills. Ashley Harrison had four assists. Wildcat JV volleyers win in 2 The Sonora Wildcat junior varsity volleyers swept Amador 25-12 and 25-8 Monday at Bud Castle Gymnasium. For Sonora, Emma Fray had five kills and four aces, Haylie Santos served for eight aces and made nine digs, Paige Houck smacked kills and Madison Fong had six kills. Sonora frosh netters beat Buffs The Wildcat freshmen volleyers cruised past the Amador Buffaloes Monday 25-12, 25-8. For Sonora, Bri Spring served 10 for 13 with four aces, Kenzie Fray served 12 for 12 with nine aces, Emma Collette served 7 for 7 with an ace, Eden Console-Taylor had three kills and Melody Warlick had two kills and one block. Sonora junior varsity water polo edges Merced 8-7 The Sonora junior varsity water polo team on Thursday defeated Merced 8-7. The ‘Cats got goals from Connor McCluskey, Levi Houghton and Ryan Grogan. But the top performer was Keanu Perez, who tallied five goals, including the game-winner with 47 seconds left. Sonora had a strong game from its goalkeeper Hayden Tolbert, who made a number of crucial fourth quarter saves. “I’m very proud of the heart and determination they showed to pull of the victory in such a gritty game,” said head coach Josh Martin.
